articles.author: RNZ
articles.title: Is dishonesty really contagious? - RNZ
articles.description: A recent study in Scientific American suggested that people tend to lie when they're in groups, especially when profit is concerned. Professor of Psychology Marc Wilson is with us to discuss whether dishonesty really is contagious.
articles.content: A recent university study in Scientific American suggested that people tend to lie when they're in groups, especially when profit is concerned. And we've probably all seen examples of people collabor… [+493 chars]

articles.title: As Ukraine loses troops, how long can it keep up the fight? - CTV News
articles.description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said this week that Ukraine is now losing 60 to 100 soldiers each day in combat. By way of comparison, just short of 50 American soldiers died per day on average in 1968 during the Vietnam War's deadliest year for U.S. …

articles.title: What you need to know to get good quality sleep and the one rule to follow - TODAY
articles.description: SINGAPORE — Former American president Donald Trump bragged about getting just three to four hours of sleep a day and some people, too, like to tell of what an over-achiever they are by how productive and efficient they can be in their wakeful hours.
